header.title: LIBER LXIX VEL PAN-PRIAPUS: Sexual Magick in Theory & Practice (A Grimoire)

central_thesis: The book serves as a comprehensive manual for operative sex magic, distilling the author's theoretical understanding and practical knowledge from diverse historical and cultural sources into explicit rituals for magical exploration.

structure_content.summary: This section delves into the author's concepts and working knowledge concerning the fundamental nature of magic and its operational principles.
Presents a broad collection of sex magic practices and insights drawn from various cultures throughout history.
Provides practical, 'how-to' instructions for rituals applicable to a wide range of magical endeavors.
Includes a glossary of essential terminology, an extensive bibliography for further study, and supplemental appendices containing 'recipes' and contact information.

key_concepts.definition: The systematic application of sexual energy and practices for magical operations, integrating theoretical understanding with historical and cultural techniques.
The literary and practical framework of magical instruction, adapted in this text to codify and transmit operative sex magic knowledge and rituals.
The author's distinct conceptualization of what magic is, how it works, and its underlying principles, forming the basis for the practical system.
A synthesis of diverse historical and global approaches to sexual magic, used to enrich and inform the book's practical rituals.

practical_system.description: The book functions as a 'readable manual' designed for operative sex magic. It integrates the author's theories on magic with historical and cross-cultural practices, providing 'how-to rituals for almost any area of exploration' to guide the practitioner.
rituals: Various sex magic rituals tailored for diverse magical objectives and areas of exploration.

relevant_quotes.text: The famed editor of Abrasax has herein distilled his concepts and working knowledge of sex magic, with fascinating chapters on his theories concerning just what magic really is and how it works.

Martin has gathered a wealth of information on practices from various cultures over history and assembled them into a very readable manual, replete with 'how to' rituals for almost any area of exploration.
His writing style is eminently direct and communicative, and often tinted with irony.
There are well chosen illustrations and the book is rounded out with a glossary of important terminology, an extensive bibliography, and several appendices containing recipes and contact addresses.
All in all, a solid work on the topic that can get you launched into more detailed studies of areas that you find to be of particular interest.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book is a 'solid work' on sex magic, providing a comprehensive and practical system. Its value lies in offering detailed theoretical insights and operative guidance for serious practitioners and researchers seeking to explore this field in depth.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Serious practitioners of sex magic, individuals seeking detailed studies in occultism, and those interested in a practical manual for magical exploration. The pricing of the editions suggests a dedicated audience.
